name: fetch-engine
description: A smart request-making library that makes sure your Javascript client is a good citizen of your distributed system.

scripts.//: `./testing` files are in typescript for linting.
in `build-conf` they are compiled for running
with karma, and after tests finish the .js files
are deleted. the `|| true` is so that typescript
doesn't fail the build because of its type checking
scripts.build-all: npm run build && npm run build-conf
scripts.specs: npm run specs-node && npm run specs-browser && npm run specs-browserstack
scripts.//: compiles `./testing` files, linting, compiling src files, testing, cleaning
the `||` in the end is for cleaning the `./testing` .js files if test fails
and -1 fails the the process so that it's recognised by Travis as a failure
scripts.test: npm run build-all && npm run lint && npm run specs && npm run clean-tests || (npm run clean-tests && -1)
